subject: Public Speaking
title: Why Practice Audiences Reduce Fear
description: A quick, practical guide to Why Practice Audiences Reduce Fear.

hook.text: Toastmasters has helped millions speak more confidently. Its secret is embarrassingly simple: practice with witnesses.

buildup.text: Practicing alone doesn't trigger the social threat response. Only a real audience activates the fear you need to train.

discovery.text: Research confirms that speaking to even 3 to 4 supportive people activates and then reduces the anxiety circuit.

twist.text: The supportive part matters. Hostile practice audiences can worsen anxiety. Safety lets the brain recalibrate.

climax.text: Your brain needs evidence that social exposure is safe. A friendly practice group provides exactly that evidence.

punchline.text: Fear shrinks when kind people watch you stumble.

quiz.question: Why is practicing in front of people more effective than practicing alone?
options: Only real audiences activate the fear response that needs desensitizing
